project.teaser: The DARE2X project is proposing a disruptive approach to decarbonising ammonia (NH3) production: development of sorption-enhanced plasma-catalytic synthesis.NH3 is the chemical produced in the second highest quantities globally and is responsible for 1.8% of global CO2...
project.objective: The DARE2X project is proposing a disruptive approach to decarbonising ammonia (NH3) production: development of sorption-enhanced plasma-catalytic synthesis. NH3 is the chemical produced in the second highest quantities globally and is responsible for 1.8% of global CO2 emissions. Furthermore, its demand is expected to increase drastically in the coming decade through its huge promise as a green fuel. As a result, decarbonisation of NH3 production is an essential goal for decarbonisation of the EU economy by 2050. The timing is vital in starting the push for future production technologies for green NH3, to meet the expected increase in demand. The main challenges for realising European green NH3 production is to transition away from fossil fuel-based, centralised Haber-Bosch facilities, to decentralised, dynamic systems that can be coupled directly to renewable electricity generators at or near the point of use. This does, however, require significant developments. DARE2X will overcome these barriers through the following game-changing solutions: (i) reactors utilising non-thermal plasma to drive NH3 synthesis; (ii) novel, more active catalysts using low-CRM materials, iii) stable and efficient NH3 sorption materials for in-situ NH3 separation. These innovations will be integrated into a single sorption-enhanced plasma-catalytic device that will be validated at TRL4. The economic, environmental and social feasibility will be assessed through LCA, LCC and a social acceptance study. To meet these objectives, DARE2X combines world-leading research institutions and innovative and R&D-performing SMEs specialised in renewable technologies, materials engineering, and technology demonstrations. The novel DARE2X approach has the potential to make decentralised production of green NH3 cost-competitive, providing European self-sufficiency of this vital future fuel, and creating European scientific and innovation excellence that will spawn new companies and create jobs.
project.title: Decentralised Ammonia production from Renewable Energy utilising novel sorption-enhanced plasma-catalytic Power-to-X technology
project.keywords: Renewable Energy, Green Fuel, Ammonia, Power2X, Sustainability, Green Transition, Decarbonisation, Decentralisation, Energy Independence, Resiliance

result.title: Summary of experiments WP4 (methods, results, data)
result.description: Report summarising experiments in Task 4.1-4.4 including methods, results, and data except for results that will be disseminated in other ways (papers or patents). This includes reactor design, catalyst performance, modelling of plasma reaction and the effect of plasma on sorption material stability and NH3 adsorption. Related to KPI6.

result.title: Ethics Protocol (Initial Version)
result.description: TYPE: ETHICSFirst version of Ethics protocol. Will be revised in D1.5 (M24)

result.title: Summary of experiments WP3 (methods, results, data)
result.description: Report summarising experiments in Task 3.1-3.2 including methods, results, and data except for results that will be disseminated in other ways (papers or patents). This includes study of zeolites NH3 capacity, kinetic behaviour, and cycle capacity. Related to KPI5.

result.title: Economic assessment of full scale DARE2X technology for H2 storage by its conversion into NH3 at low-pressure and temperature (Initial assessment)
result.description: The initial economic assessment will be a Life cycle costing analysis with focus on material selection and process options. The goal is to guide the project towards economic sound options.

result.title: Summary of experiments WP2 (methods, results, data)
result.description: Report summarising experiments in Task 2.1-2.5 including methods, results, and data except for results that will be disseminated in other ways (papers or patents). This includes, synthesis of catalyst, comparison with theoretical models, effects of promotors, catalyst synthesis incorporated on sorption material and upscaling of synthesis. Related to KPI1-KPI4.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan - Version 2
result.description: The plan will define all direct and indirect stakeholders with the contribution of the partners, proper dissemination channel and tools tailored for each target group to transfer key-identified messages about the project objectives, activities, benefits, and impacts. A timeline will also be established for each communication activity. The plan will identify Qualitative and Quantitative Performance Indicators (i.e., webpage visitors, e-newsletter recipients, social network followers, events participants profiles. results from events evaluation etc.) for the distribution channels to constantly monitor and measure dissemination and communication activities. This is an updated plan based on D7.

result.title: Ethics Protocol (Final Version)
result.description: Type: ETHICSFinal version of Ethics Protocol for the project.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan - Version 1
result.description: A first version of the exploitation strategy will be made and used to form the Dissemination and Communication plan.The Dissemination and Communication plan will define all direct and indirect stakeholders with the contribution of the partners, proper dissemination channel and tools tailored for each target group to transfer key-identified messages about the project objectives, activities, benefits, and impacts. A timeline will also be established for each communication activity. The plan will identify Qualitative and Quantitative Performance Indicators (i.e., webpage visitors, e-newsletter recipients, social network followers, events participants profiles. results from events evaluation etc.) for the distribution channels to constantly monitor and measure dissemination and communication activities.

result.title: Report on non-thermal plasma reactor design and optimal parameters
result.description: Report on plasma reactor design and optimal parameters for ammonia synthesis. Plasma reactor design benchmarked to other non-thermal plasma configurations and alternative NH3 synthesis processes. Related to Task 4.1-4.2 and KPI6.

result.title: Deliver a sorption unit for validation
result.description: Deliver a sorption unit for two stage process (Task 5.2). This should be able adsorb and desorb NH3 using temperature and pressure control.

result.title: Environmental assessment of full scale DARE2X technology for H2 storage by its conversion into NH3 at low-pressure and temperature (Initial assessment)
result.description: Initial life cycle analysis comparing different material and process options in WP2-4. This initial LCA is focused on materials selection and process parameters to guide the project towards the most sustainable option.

result.title: Report on rational catalyst design and results of screening study
result.description: Report showing results of theoretical screening study of catalyst (Task 2.2). This includes description of the DFT model, comparison with experimental data (Task 2.1) and suggestion of potential catalyst candidates with higher activity and less critical raw materials. Related to KPI1 and KPI2.

result.title: Room Temperature Plasma-Based Ammonia Synthesis – Designing an Optimal Adsorbent

details.authors: T. Kristenssen, B. Rolim, C. Hulteberg

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
